definition[0]: the natural process of depositing a substance on rocks or soil
definition[1]: a statement written or recorded for a court of law, by someone who has promised to tell the truth
definition[2]: the act of removing someone from a position of power
definition[3]: a formal statement that someone makes to a court about facts relating to a court case
example[1]: The plant safety director said in a deposition that the broken cable should have been repaired the night before.
